intro: Baeckea thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly aromatic scent, resembling thyme. Baeckea thymifolia is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
